data.enText: remove
to remove sth from a surface by moving sth sharp and hard like a knife across it
She scraped the mud off her boots.

data.chText: 孩子们把自己的盘子擦得干干净净。
data.enText: The kids had scraped their plates clean.
damage
to rub sth by accident so that it gets damaged or hurt
I scraped the side of my car on the wall.

data.chText: 抱歉，我把车刮掉了一块漆。
data.enText: Sorry, I've scraped some paint off the car.

data.chText: 她摔了一跤，把膝盖蹭破了。
data.enText: She fell and scraped her knee.

data.chText: 她的手指头让金属丝刮掉了皮。
data.enText: The wire had scraped the skin from her fingers.
make sound
to make an unpleasant noise by rubbing against a hard surface; to make sth do this

data.chText: 我听得见他的钢笔在纸上沙沙地响。
data.enText: I could hear his pen scraping across the paper.

data.chText: 我们听得见她正一个劲儿吱吱呀呀地拉小提琴。
data.enText: We could hear her scraping away at the violin.

data.chText: 别把椅子在地板上蹭得嘎吱嘎吱响。
data.enText: Don't scrape your chairs on the floor.
win with difficulty
to manage to win or to get sth with difficulty
The team scraped a narrow victory last year.
I just scraped a pass in the exam.

data.chText: 他们在街头演奏音乐，勉强维持生活。
data.enText: They scraped a living by playing music on the streets.

data.chText: 政府以三票的微弱优势勉强过关。
data.enText: The government scraped home (= just won) by three votes.
make hole in ground
to make a hole or hollow place in the ground

data.chText: 他找了个合适的地方，挖个坑，把包埋了进去。
data.enText: He found a suitable place, scraped a hole and buried the bag in it.
pull hair back
to pull your hair tightly back, away from your face

data.chText: 她的头发拢在后面，扎成一个马尾辫。
data.enText: Her hair was scraped back from her face in a ponytail.
scrape (the bottom of) the barrel
to have to use whatever things or people you can get, because there is not much choice available
bow and scrape
to be too polite to an important person in order to gain their approval
scrape by (on sth)

data.chText: （靠…）勉强维持生计，糊口，艰难度日
data.enText: to manage to live on the money you have, but with difficulty

data.chText: 我靠父母给的那点钱只能勉强度日。
data.enText: I can just scrape by on what my parents give me.
scrape in
scrape into sth

data.chText: 勉强获得（工作、职位、入学资格等）
data.enText: to manage to get a job, a position, a place at college, etc., but with difficulty
He scraped in with 180 votes.

data.chText: 我们这支队勉强挤入半决赛。
data.enText: Our team just scraped into the semi-finals.
scrape sth↔out
to remove sth from inside sth else, using sth sharp or hard like a knife
Scrape out the flesh of the melon with a spoon.
scrape through
scrape through sth

data.chText: 艰难完成；勉强通过（考试）
data.enText: to succeed in doing sth with difficulty, especially in passing an exam

data.chText: 要是走运的话，我也许能勉强及格。
data.enText: I might scrape through the exam if I'm lucky.
scrape sth↔together/up

data.chText: 勉强凑集；费力聚拢；艰难筹措
data.enText: to obtain or collect together sth, but with difficulty

data.chText: 我们好不容易凑齐八名志愿者。
data.enText: We managed to scrape together eight volunteers.
action/sound
the action or unpleasant sound of one thing rubbing roughly against another

data.chText: 铁摩擦石头发出的嚓嚓声
data.enText: the scrape of iron on stone
damage
an injury or a mark caused by rubbing against sth rough

data.chText: 她从翻了的车里钻出来，只擦破一点皮，碰了几块淤青。
data.enText: She emerged from the overturned car with only a few scrapes and bruises.
difficult situation
a difficult situation that you have caused yourself
He was always getting into scrapes as a boy.
scrape (the bottom of) the barrel
to have to use whatever things or people you can get, because there is not much choice available
bow and scrape
to be too polite to an important person in order to gain their approval
scrape by (on sth)

data.chText: （靠…）勉强维持生计，糊口，艰难度日
data.enText: to manage to live on the money you have, but with difficulty

data.chText: 我靠父母给的那点钱只能勉强度日。
data.enText: I can just scrape by on what my parents give me.
scrape in
scrape into sth

data.chText: 勉强获得（工作、职位、入学资格等）
data.enText: to manage to get a job, a position, a place at college, etc., but with difficulty
He scraped in with 180 votes.

data.chText: 我们这支队勉强挤入半决赛。
data.enText: Our team just scraped into the semi-finals.
scrape sth↔out
to remove sth from inside sth else, using sth sharp or hard like a knife
Scrape out the flesh of the melon with a spoon.
scrape through
scrape through sth

data.chText: 艰难完成；勉强通过（考试）
data.enText: to succeed in doing sth with difficulty, especially in passing an exam

data.chText: 要是走运的话，我也许能勉强及格。
data.enText: I might scrape through the exam if I'm lucky.
scrape sth↔together/up

data.chText: 勉强凑集；费力聚拢；艰难筹措
data.enText: to obtain or collect together sth, but with difficulty

data.chText: 我们好不容易凑齐八名志愿者。
data.enText: We managed to scrape together eight volunteers.

trans: 勉强通过（考试）；（在竞争、选举中）勉强获胜

tr: a deep bow with the foot drawn backwards (indicating excessive humility)
example: all that bowing and scraping did not impress him

tr: a harsh noise made by scraping
example: the scrape of violin bows distracted her

tr: an abraded area where the skin is torn or worn off

example: The cat scraped at the armchair

tr: bruise, cut, or injure the skin or the surface of
example: The boy skinned his knee when he fell

tr: gather (money or other resources) together over time
example: She had scraped together enough money for college
They scraped a letter into the stone

tr: bend the knees and bow in a servile manner

value.def: If you scrape something from a surface, you remove it, especially by pulling a sharp object over the surface.

example.ex: She went round the car scraping the frost off the windows...
example.tran: 她把结霜的车窗挨个儿擦干净。

example.ex: Young children were trying to scrape up some of the rice that spilled from the sacks.
example.tran: 小孩子们正试图铲起从麻袋中散落的米粒儿。

value.tran: (尤指用锋利物)刮落,削掉，擦掉

value.def: If something scrapes against something else or if someone or something scrapes something else, it rubs against it, making a noise or causing slight damage.

example.ex: The only sound is that of knives and forks scraping against china...
example.tran: 只听见刀叉摩擦瓷器的刺耳声。

example.ex: The cab driver struggled with her luggage, scraping a bag against the door as they came in...
example.tran: 出租车司机费力地拿着她的行李，进门时把一个包剐破了。

example.ex: The car hurtled past us, scraping the wall and screeching to a halt...
example.tran: 汽车从我们身边疾驰而过，蹭到墙壁上然后戛然刹住。

example.ex: There was a scraping sound as she dragged the heels of her shoes along the pavement.
example.tran: 她拖着脚走，鞋跟蹭着人行道嚓嚓作响。

example.ex: From the other side of the door came the scrape of a guard's boot.
example.tran: 从门的另一侧传来了保安嚓嚓的马靴声。

value.tran: 摩擦使发出刺耳声;擦伤;蹭破

example.ex: The house was silent but for the scraping of a branch on the slates.
example.tran: 这所房子寂静无声，只听见树枝刮擦着石板瓦吱吱作响。

value.def: If you scrape a part of your body, you accidentally rub it against something hard and rough, and damage it slightly.

example.ex: She stumbled and fell, scraping her palms and knees.
example.tran: 她绊了一下摔倒了，手掌和膝盖都蹭破了。

value.def: If you are in a scrape, you are in a difficult situation which you have caused yourself.
